title: Spice Lux luxury responsive marketing website (React + TS + Tailwind) with WhatsApp enquiry + contact form persistence

requirements.summary: Implement the full responsive Spice Lux marketing site UI with the required pages/sections and exact hero headline + CTAs.
acceptanceCriteria: Site renders all specified sections with the exact headline and CTA labels provided.
Navigation allows users to access each section/page on desktop and mobile.
Layout is mobile-first and remains usable at common breakpoints (mobile/tablet/desktop).

file_operations.description: Create the single-page layout that composes the required sections (Home, About, Products, Why Choose, Testimonials, Contact) with proper section IDs for navigation and mobile-first responsive layout.
Add a reusable layout wrapper (header/main/footer structure) to keep the UI organized and consistent across sections.
Implement Home hero with exact headline “Spice Lux – Luxury You Can Taste”, CTAs (Order Now / Bulk Enquiry / Contact Us), and 3 feature callouts (Export Quality | Handpicked | Hygienically Packed).
Implement About Spice Lux section with luxury brand content structure and semantic headings.
Implement Products section container with two product cards area and section heading.
Implement Why Choose Spice Lux section with concise bullet/value props styling suitable for premium marketing content.
Implement Testimonials section with a responsive layout and accessible typography.
Implement Contact section shell that will include form, contact links, WhatsApp CTA, and map embed (form wiring covered in REQ-6/REQ-7).
Create a small shared Section wrapper component to standardize spacing, max-width, and heading alignment across sections.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive luxury theme across the site using the provided palette via Tailwind tokens and consistent component styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary/secondary/background/accent colors reflect the provided palette across the whole site.
Buttons, cards, and headings have a cohesive luxury look (high contrast, refined typography, consistent spacing).

file_operations.description: Define global CSS variables and base styles for the luxury palette (deep red, matte black, gold highlights, natural green accents) and typography; ensure Tailwind base layers are set up.
Extend Tailwind theme with brand-friendly tokens (colors/shadows/typography) mapped to CSS variables to enforce consistent luxury styling across sections.

Create a small wrapper around existing button primitives to standardize variants (primary/gold accent/outline) and spacing for a premium look. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a shared card wrapper to standardize matte-black backgrounds, gold borders/highlights, and refined hover states. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a sticky navbar with section links and an accessible responsive mobile menu.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar remains visible while scrolling on desktop and mobile.
Mobile menu is accessible and can be opened/closed; links scroll/navigate to the correct section.

file_operations.description: Implement a sticky navbar with links to Home/About/Products/Why Choose/Testimonials/Contact and an accessible mobile menu (e.g., using a drawer/sheet pattern). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a skip-to-content link for accessibility and improved landmark navigation on a single-page layout.
Add a small helper to smoothly scroll to section IDs (and close the mobile menu on navigation) while keeping behavior consistent across browsers.
Wire Navbar + SkipToContent into the layout header and ensure main has an ID/landmark target for skip navigation.
Ensure each required section has the correct anchor ID and is reachable via navbar link interactions on desktop and mobile.

requirements.summary: Build the Products section with two product cards (Cardamom and Black Pepper) with images, descriptions, grades/weights, hover effects, and Enquire Now buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: Both products are displayed with images, descriptions, grades/weights, and a visible “Enquire Now” CTA.
Hover/focus states are implemented and accessible (keyboard focus styles present).

file_operations.description: Create a reusable ProductCard component that renders product image, name, provided suggested description, grades/weights list, and an “Enquire Now” button with elegant hover + visible focus styles.
Render exactly two ProductCard instances for Green Cardamom and Black Pepper and pass the correct image paths and product copy.

requirements.summary: Implement WhatsApp deep-link CTAs with prefilled messages referencing Spice Lux and selected product when applicable.
acceptanceCriteria: Order Now CTA opens a WhatsApp deep link in a new tab/window.
Product “Enquire Now” buttons open WhatsApp with a message that includes the product name.

file_operations.description: Add a utility to build WhatsApp deep links (with URL-encoded prefilled message including Spice Lux and optional product name) and open them in a new tab/window; include concise comments explaining message composition.
Wire Home hero CTAs (Order Now / Bulk Enquiry / Contact Us) so Order Now and Bulk Enquiry open WhatsApp with prefilled messages; Contact Us scrolls/navigates to the Contact section.
Wire each product “Enquire Now” button to WhatsApp with a message that includes the corresponding product name.
Add a WhatsApp “Order Now” button in Contact that opens WhatsApp with a general Spice Lux enquiry message.

requirements.summary: Create the Contact section with contact form, visible/clickable phone+email, WhatsApp CTA, and Google Maps embed.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact form includes basic fields (name, email/phone, message) with client-side validation and a clear success/error state.
Phone number and email are visible and clickable (tel: and mailto: links).
Google Maps embed renders in the Contact section/page.

file_operations.description: Implement a contact form with fields (name, email/phone, message), client-side validation, and clear success/error UI states; keep it accessible with proper labels and error messaging.
Compose ContactForm, add visible/clickable tel: and mailto: links, include WhatsApp button, and add a Google Maps embed iframe with a sensible placeholder location URL and accessible title.

requirements.summary: Persist Contact form submissions by calling the existing Motoko canister message-saving capability and provide a dev-only way to query saved submissions for verification.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the form calls the backend and stores the submission (name, contact, message, timestamp).
Backend exposes a query method that returns saved submissions for verification.
Frontend displays a user-friendly confirmation after a successful submission and an error message on failure.

file_operations.description: Create React Query hooks to submit a contact message and (for development/testing) fetch saved messages using the existing backend interface exposed via the actor.
Wire form submission to the submit hook; on success show confirmation and reset fields; on failure show a clear error state; add concise comments around the submission flow.
Add a lightweight dev-only panel (hidden by default, enabled via a simple URL flag) that queries and displays saved submissions for verification during development/testing.
Conditionally render DevSubmissionsPanel only when the dev flag is present so the public marketing experience remains clean.

requirements.summary: Add subtle animations and SEO/accessibility structure (semantic headings, meta tags, landmarks) while keeping performance fast.
acceptanceCriteria: Animations are subtle (e.g., fade/slide-in) and do not block interaction or degrade performance.
Pages/sections use semantic structure (H1/H2 hierarchy) and include appropriate meta tags.
Lighthouse-style checks show no obvious SEO/accessibility anti-patterns (e.g., missing alt text).

file_operations.description: Add meta description (and any other lightweight, static SEO tags) for Spice Lux while preserving the existing title and viewport meta.
Implement a lightweight IntersectionObserver hook to apply subtle reveal animations as sections/cards enter the viewport (no heavy animation libraries).
Create a small wrapper that uses the reveal hook to apply fade/slide-in classes; ensure it is non-blocking and respects reduced-motion preferences.
Ensure semantic heading structure (single H1 in hero; subsequent sections use H2) and add subtle, performant animations via the Reveal wrapper; ensure all images include meaningful alt text.
Apply subtle reveal/hover animations and ensure focus/keyboard accessibility remains intact.

requirements.summary: Maintain a clean, production-ready frontend structure with readable code and concise comments around non-obvious logic.
acceptanceCriteria: Key modules/components are separated logically (layout, sections, shared components).
Non-obvious logic includes short explanatory comments.

file_operations.description: Create a barrel export for section components to keep imports clean and maintain a readable project structure.
Add concise comments documenting WhatsApp deep-link formatting decisions and where to update the phone number/message template.
Add concise comments documenting how React Query interacts with the actor and how dev verification querying is enabled.

requirements.summary: Add and wire generated static images for the hero and products (plus feature icons) from frontend/public/assets/generated into the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist at frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Hero uses the hero image; each product card uses its corresponding product image with descriptive alt text.

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero image asset as a static frontend file (do not serve from backend).
Add the generated green cardamom product image asset as a static frontend file (do not serve from backend).
Add the generated black pepper product image asset as a static frontend file (do not serve from backend).
Add the generated Export Quality icon as a static frontend file for the Home feature callout.
Add the generated Handpicked icon as a static frontend file for the Home feature callout.
Add the generated Hygienically Packed icon as a static frontend file for the Home feature callout.

Render the hero image from frontend/public/assets/generated/spice-lux-hero.dim_1600x900.png and render the three feature icons from frontend/public/assets/generated/icon-export-quality.dim_128x128.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/icon-handpicked.dim_128x128.png, and frontend/public/assets/generated/icon-hygienically-packed.dim_128x128.png with descriptive alt text.

Pass the correct static image paths to the two product cards: frontend/public/assets/generated/product-cardamom.dim_800x600.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/product-black-pepper.dim_800x600.png, ensuring descriptive alt text.
